title: Ticket #1413: Condor Cron on Windows is no longer functioning
description:
This problem was reported to Cycle Computing by Hartford Life. They have a more complicated setup but Doug was able to reproduce the failure with a pretty simple .bat file.

Pre 7.0.5 everything was fine. This cron job caused no issues and ran successfully on Windows. With a switch to 7.4.2 Hartford is unable to run the cron job. Doug confirmed this was still working as of 7.2.x.

Here are the details for recreating the problem using a simple .bat file:

In your config file: 

STARTD_CRON_NAME = SYSCAPS
SYSCAPS_JOBLIST = PRTDIAG
SYSCAPS_PRTDIAG_EXECUTABLE = C:/Condor/test.bat
SYSCAPS_PRTDIAG_PERIOD = 1m

The file used is a simple batch file: 

echo %TIME% > c:\condor\test.out

We get the following output in StartLog: 

05/14 15:33:47 Create_Process(): executable: 'C:/Condor/test.bat'
05/14 15:33:47 Executable is a batch file, running: "C:\WINDOWS\system32\cmd.exe" /Q /C "C:/Condor/test.bat" PRTDIAG
05/14 15:33:47 GetBinaryType() returned 0
05/14 15:33:47 Create_Process: CreateProcess failed, errno=267
05/14 15:33:47 Cron: Error running job 'PRTDIAG'

In 7.2 we got this output: 

5/14 12:34:25 Executable is a batch script, so executing C:\WINDOWS\system32\cmd.exe  /Q /C "C:/Condor/test.bat"  PRTDIAG
5/14 12:34:25 GetBinaryType() returned 0
5/14 12:34:25 Cron: STDOUT closed for 'PRTDIAG'
5/14 12:34:25 Cron: STDERR closed for 'PRTDIAG'
5/14 12:34:25 Cron: 'PRTDIAG' (pid 448) exit_status=0

Hey guys: any updates on this? This is a feature used heavily in some enterprise client accounts.

Thanks!

2010-Jun-08 16:17:05 by tannenba:
Hmmmm... in the above log snippet, errno is 267 from Create_Process, which on Win32 means: "The directory name is invalid".

I am going to assign this ticket to Pete, and he'll check and see if this problem is specific to Windows or also can be reproduced on Linux. If the latter, Pete will work on a patch; if the former, he'll reassign to Cathrin.

2010-Jun-09 11:15:47 by psilord:
Using 7.4.2, I attempted to reproduce this on unix with this config file setup: 

STARTD_CRON_NAME = SYSCAPS
SYSCAPS_JOBLIST = PRTDIAG
SYSCAPS_PRTDIAG_EXECUTABLE = /tmp/foobar
SYSCAPS_PRTDIAG_PERIOD = 1m

It worked as expected.

I found this forum thread which talks about unexpected conditions one may get an invalid directory when trying to exec a process under windows. Search for "invalid". It may be of help to Cathrin.
